readability_reflection: String concatenation is more readable for me because it keeps everything straightforward and separated, making it easier to control how the string is built. For example, "Hello, " + name + "!" is clear about what’s being added to the string, while interpolation can sometimes be harder to track when more variables are involved.
comprehension_debugging: Using string concatenation didn’t affect my ability to understand or debug code much, but when there are multiple variables, it can become a bit harder to follow. The + operator clearly shows how the pieces are connected, but long expressions can look cluttered.
preference_rationale: I would prefer string concatenation for future tasks because it feels more explicit and flexible. I can easily add spaces, punctuation, or different variables without worrying about the format of the string.
learning_curve: My prior experience with concatenation made understanding the provided code examples easier. I’m used to seeing the + operator, so it felt natural and intuitive to read through the code.
suggestions_improvement: To improve string concatenation, I think using clearer functions or syntax (like automatically handling spaces) could make it more readable. A simpler way to insert variables into strings without worrying about + could make the code look cleaner.
